alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Johnson County through 1230 AM CDT... At 1159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Pat Cleburne, or near Cleburne, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burleson, Cleburne, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Venus, Grandview, Godley, Cross Timber, Cleburne State Park, Lake Pat Cleburne, Parker, Rio Vista, Briaroaks, Coyote Flats, Sand Flat, Egan and Lillian. This includes Interstate 35W between mile markers 14 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and north central Texas.
